Detailed Description

APIs in this file couple a BIOS Task with a mailbox in order to allow application to implement a state machine kind of logic, where in state change happens based on received message's

Typedef Documentation

typedef void(* BspUtils_TskFuncMain) (struct BspUtils_TskHndl_t *pHndl, BspUtils_MsgHndl *pMsg)

Task main function.

This function is called when a message is received by the task.

Parameters
pHndl[OUT] Task handle
pMsg[OUT] Received message

Function Documentation

static Int32 BspUtils_tskAckOrFreeMsg ( BspUtils_MsgHndl *  pMsg,
Int32  result 
)
inlinestatic

ACK or free received message.

Refer to BspUtils_mbxAckOrFreeMsg() for details

Int32 BspUtils_tskCreate ( BspUtils_TskHndl *  pHndl,
BspUtils_TskFuncMain  funcMain,
UInt32  tskPri,
UInt8 *  stackAddr,
UInt32  stackSize,
Ptr  appData,
char *  tskName 
)

Create a task.

Parameters
pHndl[OUT] Task handle
funcMain[IN] Task main, Note, this is different from BIOS Task, since this function is entered ONLY when a message is received.
tskPri[IN] Task priority as defined by BIOS
stackAddr[IN] Task stack address
stackSize[IN] Task stack size
appData[IN] Application specific data
tskName[IN] Task name
Returns
FVID2_SOK on success else failure
Int32 BspUtils_tskDelete ( BspUtils_TskHndl *  pHndl)

Delete a task.

Parameters
pHndl[OUT] Task handle
Returns
FVID2_SOK on success else failure
